alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 11:57PM CDT until April 05 at 2:04PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 90.0 feet, Major flooding will occur along the creek. Fair Oaks Ave near the bridge will start to flood. Park and playground east of Abrams Rd will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 86.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM CDT Monday was 86.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to near 90 feet after midnight and fall below flood stage by sunrise. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 89.7 feet on 05/17/1989. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 215 PM CDT.
